text:
Hi,
I am trying to get all email engagement threads of a particular contact. Can anyone help me out with how can I achieve this?
Hi <@U03DU06MZ7Y>, any idea on how to solve the error, thanks!

Hi!
From this message we can only say that the ID is missing from the endpoint used in the backend.  As you can see it is undefined `context":{"id":["undefined"]}.`  
You need to have access to the backend code in order to see why is it missing and fix it.

Hello.
I'm trying to fetch a contact's activities, for this purpose I send
`<https://api.hubapi.com/events/v3/events?objectType=contact&objectId={contactId}>`
I expect to get `Ads activity` data with an information about Google Ads campaign.
But there is only one event `e_submitted_form`  entry present in results.
Does anyone know what kind of activities API provides, or which endpoint should I use for this?
Hmmm....  I think you need to first search for the records you want to update and then use those ID values for your batch update.
good idea to add though and get some upvotes

Hi, I'm looking for advice on this same subject. It looks like the API has since been improved to allow us to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies|merge companies>. I don't understand what's meant by companies "with the same type"? Are there any limitations that I should understand? Or should I be able to build logic using whatever data I want on the company records themselves and then execute the merge through API?

I'm intending to do several thousand separate merges to eliminate duplicates and account hierarchies in our instance. Would appreciate any advice! thank you

Hi all,

I'm creating deals using API, for `createdate` setting value unix timestamp with midnight (1707762600000) Tue Feb 13 2024 00:00:00 GMT+0530 (India Standard Time), Client configured timezone UTC -08:00 Los Angeles, After deal created in my system (IST) it shows 02/13/2024 5:30 AM GMT+5:30, But in client machine it shows 02/12/2024 7:00 PM EST, Client expect it should be `Tue Feb 13 2024`, any idea about this issue?

<@U063D0GCSHF> let's say we have a landing page to download an ebook. We would want it under multiple campaigns:
• at the "group of marketing activities for a period of time" level
• at the "content type" level
• at the "business unit" level

Working with datetime fields can be an incredibly frustrating experience. Regardless of portal/account timezone settings, when viewing datetime property data, the time will be adjusted to the current user’s local timezone. So in order for the EST client to see Feb 13th in your example, you would need to set the unixtimestamp +5 hours (1707802200000).

Hello, I am trying to make an API call for meetings, specifically the property for meeting owner/ meeting assigned to. However whenever I use an API GET request for the property "HubSpot_owner_id" I get an ID for a custom object that is associated with the contact and not the person who set up the meeting. I was wondering if anyone has had a similar issue, or an explanation to why it is acting this way?
<@U05LBT9L00H> you’d need to use `hs_created_by`

<@U03REFNRMB3> Thanks for the help. I tried using that property, but for some reason I'm getting a string of numbers that does not point to anything in my HubSpot account whenever I put it into my search bar. Are the numbers for "created by" different than would show for regular contacts since they're users?
Can you show the example of the string of numbers?
Here is the current output from the GET call

Is that ID the contact Record id that booked the meeting through the meetings tool? 

Or is this specific meeting one that was created via the CRM UI and assigned to another person?

The id in the ID property is the engagement id of the meeting. This test meeting was created through the CRM UI by me and another contact in the sandbox. The reason that it is pulling the ID for the meeting is that I am using the URL /crm/v3/objects/meetings
That ID will likely match a user in your account. Check HubSpot users(or record owner property) to find the user.

Sorry, when I meant ID, I was referring to  
`hs_created_by`

Hi all,

Has anyone been able to successfully pull physical address information from the contacts endpoint? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

(like city, state, country, street address, zip)
Got it <@U039PUBV59N>, this will affect reports right, Not sure how reports work in this case
Client worries about the deal i created in month of first day, their side shows previous month last day, This will affect the reports

Hi! I have searched and tested a lot of code and this slack is my last hope so I would love any suggestions!

I'm trying to pull back the meetings that a deal has. I need to see when first meeting was created on the deal and if the prospective deal  was a no show or not to that meeting. I can not for the life of me connect the meetings and deals through the api. I have tried a bunch with the engagements api and meetings api but I'm struggling. any suggestions or is this even possible to tie it back to the deal?
